alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 27 at 3:51AM PDT until March 28 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches except 1 to 4 inches along US-97 between Bend and La Pine and below 4000 feet along US-20. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 8 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates of 1-2 inches per hour are expected along the Cascade crest this evening through Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
